content.content: Was just rewatching some talks from 35c3 and stumbled upon sober arguments. Wonder if we should try this for contentious discussions. Current candidates could be e.g. ProgPow as far as I see.
content.GPT-summary: The post is a suggestion to use a method called "sober arguments" for contentious discussions, using ProgPow as an example. The author is not explaining the proposal in detail, but rather asking if the method could be useful for discussing it.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: bringing this up again after the tweet by @souptacular   twitter.com          Hudson Jameson (hudsonjameson)     1/ The Ethereum community could really use a compliation of all of the arguments for and against #ProgPoW. I have seen many and have tried to pay attention, but it's a lot to absorb. Anyone want to volunteer to create a summary for or against? It doesn't have to be a complete        ☠l̶̫͚̍̃͊͐e̷̛̊x̸-̴̿n̷̛̜̣̥͛̋͛̓ǒ̶̾̿̒͂̈́̍d̸͛̔̽ë̵́ ☠ @lex_node           The IP issue seems like quite a worrisome one....You can't know if ProgPOW is actually open source unless you identify the people who worked on it, their competing commitments and how they understood their contributions....   https://twitter.com/BobSummerwill/status/1174100802446577664 …           7:52 PM - 17 Sep 2019     40          8
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I have started a Kialo discussion for this. Based on my research, Kialo is the most practical and useful rational debate platform out there at the moment. Interested to see how people engage with it!    Kialo – 18 Sep 19    Should Ethereum adopt Programmatic Proof-of-Work (ProgPow)? Hudson's request that we catalogue the for and against in this debate in a better format twitter.com  Background from Ethereum Magicians forum:…
